contextId.information: These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

"Libnites" and "Shimeites" are the name of clans, named after the head of their family. The "Gershonites" is the name of people who descended from Gershon. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"This was what Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai gave as a sacrifice" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
contextId.quote: This was the sacrifice of Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai

contextId.information: "This was what Pagiel son of Ochran gave as a sacrifice" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
contextId.quote: This was the sacrifice of Pagiel son of Ochran

contextId.information: This is the name of a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a place in the desert. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are men's names. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are all men's names. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
contextId.quote: Shaphat ... Hori ... Jephunneh ... Igal ... Joseph ... Nun

contextId.information: These are all men's names. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
contextId.quote: Palti ... Raphu ... Gaddiel ... Sodi ... Gaddi ... Susi ... Ammiel ... Gemalli

contextId.information: These are all men's names. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
contextId.quote: Sethur ... Michael ... Nahbi ... Vophsi ... Geuel ... Machi

contextId.information: These are names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a place. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a place. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Balak was king of Moab. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of Balaam's father. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a town. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Translators may add a footnote that says: "The word 'Zophim' means 'to watch' or 'to spy.'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

Here "higher" refers to greater honor and power. This means the future king of Israel will have more honor and will be more powerful than Agag. Agag was king of the Amalekites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: Their king is to be higher than Agag

contextId.information: This is the name of a people group who descended from Kain. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is a range of mountains in Moab. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of kings of Midian. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
contextId.quote: Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba

contextId.information: This is the name of a place. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:num:13:23|13:23]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a man. Translate this name in the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:num:26:28|26:29]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a man. Translate this name in the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:num:26:33|26:33]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
